rules.name: ADA Accessible Door Minimum Clear Width
rules.description: Door openings on accessible routes must provide a minimum clear width of 815 mm (32 inches) in accordance with ADA 2010 Standards Section 404.2.3.

explanation.short: Accessible doors on accessible routes must have a clear opening width of at least 815 mm (32 in).
explanation.on_fail: Door {guid} is marked as accessible but has clear width {lhs} mm, below the required {rhs} mm (ADA 404.2.3).
explanation.on_pass: Door {guid} meets the ADA minimum clear width requirement ({lhs} mm ≥ {rhs} mm, ADA 404.2.3).

rules.name: Fire Exit Door Minimum Height
rules.description: Doors in a means of egress must have a minimum clear height of 2032 mm (80 inches) to ensure safe emergency egress, in accordance with IBC Section 1010.1.1.

explanation.short: Fire exit doors must provide a clear height of at least 2032 mm (80 in).
explanation.on_fail: Fire exit door {guid} has height {lhs} mm, below the required {rhs} mm (IBC 1010.1.1).
explanation.on_pass: Fire exit door {guid} meets the IBC minimum height requirement ({lhs} mm ≥ {rhs} mm, IBC 1010.1.1).

rules.name: Stair Minimum Width
rules.description: Stairways serving an occupant load of 50 or more must have a minimum clear width of 1118 mm (44 inches) in accordance with IBC Section 1011.2.

explanation.short: Stairways (for typical occupant loads) must have a minimum clear width of 1118 mm (44 in).
explanation.on_fail: Stair flight {guid} has width {lhs} mm, below the required {rhs} mm (IBC 1011.2).
explanation.on_pass: Stair flight {guid} meets the IBC minimum width requirement ({lhs} mm ≥ {rhs} mm, IBC 1011.2).

rules.name: Bedroom Minimum Floor Area
rules.description: Habitable rooms such as bedrooms must have a minimum floor area of 6.5 m² (70 ft²) in accordance with IRC Section R304.1/R304.2.

explanation.short: Bedrooms must have a minimum floor area of 6.5 m² (70 ft²).
explanation.on_fail: Bedroom space {guid} has area {lhs} m², below the required {rhs} m² (IRC R304.1/R304.2).
explanation.on_pass: Bedroom space {guid} meets the minimum floor area requirement ({lhs} m² ≥ {rhs} m², IRC R304.1/R304.2).

rules.name: Emergency Escape and Rescue Opening – Minimum Area
rules.description: Emergency escape and rescue openings (egress windows) must provide a minimum net clear opening area of 0.53 m² (5.7 ft²) in accordance with IRC Section R310.2.1.

explanation.short: Egress windows must provide a minimum net clear opening area of 0.53 m² (5.7 ft²).
explanation.on_fail: Egress window {guid} has clear opening area {lhs} m², below the required {rhs} m² (IRC R310.2.1).
explanation.on_pass: Egress window {guid} meets the minimum clear opening area ({lhs} m² ≥ {rhs} m², IRC R310.2.1).

rules.name: Emergency Escape and Rescue Opening – Minimum Height
rules.description: Emergency escape and rescue openings must provide a minimum net clear opening height of 610 mm (24 inches) in accordance with IRC Section R310.2.2.

explanation.short: Egress windows must provide a minimum net clear opening height of 610 mm (24 in).
explanation.on_fail: Egress window {guid} has clear opening height {lhs} mm, below the required {rhs} mm (IRC R310.2.2).
explanation.on_pass: Egress window {guid} meets the minimum clear opening height ({lhs} mm ≥ {rhs} mm, IRC R310.2.2).

rules.name: Emergency Escape and Rescue Opening – Minimum Width
rules.description: Emergency escape and rescue openings must provide a minimum net clear opening width of 508 mm (20 inches) in accordance with IRC Section R310.2.3.

explanation.short: Egress windows must provide a minimum net clear opening width of 508 mm (20 in).
explanation.on_fail: Egress window {guid} has clear opening width {lhs} mm, below the required {rhs} mm (IRC R310.2.3).
explanation.on_pass: Egress window {guid} meets the minimum clear opening width ({lhs} mm ≥ {rhs} mm, IRC R310.2.3).

rules.name: UK Accessible Door Minimum Clear Width
rules.description: Accessible doors in dwellings must provide a minimum effective clear opening width of 775 mm in accordance with UK Building Regulations Approved Document M.

explanation.short: UK regulations require an effective clear opening width of at least 775 mm for accessible doors in new dwellings.
explanation.on_fail: Accessible door {guid} has clear width {lhs} mm, below the UK requirement of {rhs} mm (Approved Document M).
explanation.on_pass: Accessible door {guid} meets the UK minimum clear width requirement ({lhs} mm ≥ {rhs} mm, Approved Document M).

provenance.regulation: UK Building Regulations – Approved Document M
provenance.section: Access to and Use of Buildings
provenance.title: Minimum Effective Clear Widths of Doors

rules.name: Canadian Accessible Door Minimum Clear Width
rules.description: Doorways on accessible paths of travel must provide a minimum clear opening width of 850 mm in accordance with Canadian accessibility standards and National Building Code adaptations.

explanation.short: Canadian accessibility guidance typically requires a minimum door clear opening width of 850 mm on accessible routes.
explanation.on_fail: Accessible door {guid} has clear width {lhs} mm, below the Canadian requirement of {rhs} mm (NBC/CSA B651).
explanation.on_pass: Accessible door {guid} meets the minimum Canadian clear width requirement ({lhs} mm ≥ {rhs} mm, NBC/CSA B651).

provenance.regulation: National Building Code of Canada + CSA B651
provenance.title: Door Clear Opening Width

rules.name: Fire Partition Wall – Minimum Fire-Resistance Rating
rules.description: Interior fire partitions such as corridor walls and dwelling separations are generally required to have a minimum 1-hour fire-resistance rating in accordance with IBC Section 708.3, unless specific exceptions apply.

explanation.short: Walls designated as fire partitions should provide at least a 1-hour fire-resistance rating.
explanation.on_fail: Wall {guid} is marked as a fire partition but has fire-resistance rating {lhs} h, below the required {rhs} h (IBC 708.3).
explanation.on_pass: Wall {guid} meets the minimum fire partition rating ({lhs} h ≥ {rhs} h, IBC 708.3).

rules.name: Horizontal Assembly Between Dwellings – Minimum Fire-Resistance Rating
rules.description: Horizontal assemblies (floors/ceilings) separating dwelling or sleeping units are required to be not less than 1/2-hour fire-resistance-rated construction in accordance with IBC Section 711.2.4.3.

explanation.short: Floor/ceiling assemblies separating dwelling units must be at least 1/2-hour fire-resistance rated.
explanation.on_fail: Slab {guid} separates dwelling/sleeping units but has fire-resistance rating {lhs} h, below the required {rhs} h (IBC 711.2.4.3).
explanation.on_pass: Slab {guid} meets the minimum horizontal assembly rating ({lhs} h ≥ {rhs} h, IBC 711.2.4.3).

provenance.title: Dwelling and Sleeping Unit Separations – Horizontal Assemblies

rules.name: Fire-Protected Columns – Minimum Fire-Resistance Rating
rules.description: Where columns are required to be fire-resistance rated, they must be provided with individual encasement protection for their full height with materials having the required fire-resistance rating, not less than that of the assemblies they support, in accordance with IBC Sections 704.1 and 704.2.

explanation.short: Columns that are required to be fire-resistance rated must achieve at least the specified minimum rating.
explanation.on_fail: Column {guid} is marked as requiring fire protection but has fire-resistance rating {lhs} h, below the required {rhs} h (IBC 704.1/704.2).
explanation.on_pass: Column {guid} meets the minimum fire-resistance requirement ({lhs} h ≥ {rhs} h, IBC 704.1/704.2).

provenance.title: Fire-Resistance Rating of Structural Members / Column Protection

rules.name: Window Operation Quality Check
rules.description: Windows should be operable and properly maintained for building functionality and user comfort.

explanation.short: Windows should maintain operational functionality for ventilation and user control.
explanation.on_fail: Window {guid} has operability rating {lhs}%, below recommended threshold {rhs}%.
